{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3596753,"name":"Murilo Miranda Santos","username":"murilo404","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/49beb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-19T21:49:40.410Z","cooked":"

gogod morning! my FRC team want make one thing called “reactive autonomous”, exemple: I create my auto and execute in match, but something made my auto can’t clomplete, end my auto analize for do another thing, how do another rote or use another level of reef. Someone can help me with this? Sorry by my english, i’m brazilian and don’t speak english very good kkkkk

You could start by looking at code from last year. Lots of teams did something like this where if their robot misses a note in auto, it moves on to the next one.

Previous Example:

I know that team 3015 did something like this last year. You could start by looking here (however I am not sure if this is the specific file that this happens in, you may need to do a little digging): 2024Public/RobotCode2024/src/main/java/frc/robot/commands/auto/SixNoteBranching.java at main · 3015RangerRobotics/2024Public · GitHub

A Simple Method:

Additionally, WPILib has a Conditional Command class that could work as a simple method. It works by taking in a condition (ex: a Boolean representing if your robot currently has a coral), and then runs a different command depending on if the condition is true or false.

The syntax looks like:

new ConditionalCommand(command for true, command for false, condition);

You can find the documentation for this here: ConditionalCommand (WPILib API 2025.3.2)
